snippet: Heading to the state’s primaries, the G.O.P. candidates chasing Donald J. Trump are trying to show strength.
abstract: Republican presidential candidates, facing pressure to demonstrate strength, prepare for hard fight in South Carolina primary; way candidates have attacked one another after Donald Trump's victory in New Hampshire reveals new contours of the race, with Sen Ted Cruz targeting Trump's record and three mainstream candidates vying to determine who will challenge anti-establishment ones.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Myrtle Beach, S.C.; Thomas Kaplan from Mount Pleasant, S.C.; and Jeremy Peters from Spartanburg, S.C.

lead_paragraph: Heading to the state’s primaries, the G.O.P. candidates chasing Donald J. Trump are trying to show strength.

headline.main: A Multifront Republican Battle in South Carolina
headline.print_headline: Parallel Battles as the G.O.P. Travels South
